HIV.advice: Seek medical testing and start antiretroviral therapy as early as possible.

AIDS.advice: Urgent medical care required. Ensure adherence to treatment and monitor opportunistic infections.

TB.advice: Visit a clinic for sputum test and chest X-ray. Begin anti-TB medication immediately.

Malaria.advice: Seek immediate medical attention for blood testing and antimalarial drugs.

Cancer.advice: Consult a specialist for diagnostic tests like biopsy or imaging scans.

Hypertension.advice: Monitor blood pressure and consult a doctor for antihypertensive medications.

Stroke.advice: Call emergency services immediately. This is a medical emergency.

Obesity.advice: Seek guidance on diet and exercise; may require endocrine evaluation.

Diabetes.advice: Check blood sugar levels and start dietary and/or insulin therapy.

Pregnancy.advice: Visit a clinic for confirmation and prenatal care.

Measles.advice: Isolate the patient and visit a clinic for supportive care and monitoring.

Chickenpox.advice: Stay home to avoid spread. Take antihistamines and calamine lotion.

Epilepsy.advice: Seek neurological evaluation and start anti-epileptic medication.

Corona Virus.advice: Test for COVID-19. Isolate and monitor symptoms. Seek care if breathing difficulty occurs.

Lactose Intolerance.advice: Avoid dairy or take lactase supplements. Consult a dietitian if needed.

Allergic Reactions.advice: Take antihistamines or epinephrine (EpiPen) for severe reactions. Seek emergency help if symptoms escalate.

Heart Attack.advice: Call emergency services immediately. Begin CPR if needed.

Gout.advice: Reduce purine-rich foods, hydrate, and take anti-inflammatory meds.

Sinusitis.advice: Use nasal sprays, warm compress, and consult a doctor if symptoms persist.

Flu.advice: Rest, hydrate, and take antipyretics. Visit a clinic if breathing worsens.

Endometriosis.advice: Consult a gynecologist. Hormonal therapy or surgery may be needed.

Blindness.advice: Seek urgent ophthalmic care to determine cause and potential treatment.
